name: Hardest Legion of Super Heroes: Sun Boy Trivia Quiz | Entertainment | 10 Questions

questions.text: What is Sun Boy's home planet?
questions.explanation:
Earth.

	Sun Boy's mother died in childbirth, and he was raised by his father, who was quite distant and spent the majority of his time running a nuclear power plant.

questions.text: Sun Boy originally appeared in 1961.  What is his real name?
questions.explanation:
Dirk Morgna.

	The character of Sun Boy appeared as an occasional background character on the WB animated series, "The Legion of Super Heroes".

questions.text: Unlike most Legionnaires, Sun Boy has his own personal arch nemesis. Who is it?
questions.explanation:
Dr. Regulas

	Dr. (Zaxton) Regulas worked at Sun Boy's fathers nuclear power plant.  Regulas was blamed for the death of a co-worker.  He blamed Dirk for this incident (and his dismissal) and attempted revenge by locking Dirk in an atomic reactor.  It was this incident that, instead of killing Dirk, imbued him with his powers.

questions.text: Early on in his Legion career, he is mission leader but begins to use his powers against his fellow Legionnaires and undergoes a complete personality change.  What was the cause of this behavior?
questions.explanation:
Space Fatigue.

	Because of this incident in "Adventure Comics" #318, an amendment to the Legion Constitution was created.  No Legionnaire could participate in more than five space missions without adequate time to rest and recoup.

questions.text: Sun Boy was the Legion's Lothario.  He had no reservations in cashing in his Legion credentials for the opportunity to score a date (or more).  Only once in the original continuity did he have an ongoing relationship of any sort.  Who was this relationship with?
questions.explanation:
Gigi Cusimano.

	Gigi Cusimano was a Science Police officer and liaison with the Legion.  She was a long time friend of fellow Legionnaire, Colossal Boy.

questions.text: During the '5 Year Later (5YL)' continuity, readers found out the Sun Boy left the Legion and was then hired by Earthgov to handle public relations.  Sadly, Earthgov turned out to be under the control of what foreign entity?
questions.explanation:
The Dominators.

	When the facts of the treason within Earthgov were learned by the public, Sun Boy was then branded a traitor.

questions.text: In the '5 Year Later' continuity, there is a younger group of Legionnaires, believed to be clones of the original Legion members.  Referred to as the Batch SW6 Legion, most of these younger versions of older Legion members would take on updated code names.  What code name did Batch SW6 Sun Boy adopt?
questions.explanation:
Inferno.

	The 5 Year Later Legion members, and the Batch SW6 Legionnaires would join together in the last issue of the series, in order to assist with the universe resetting itself.  They would all be wiped from existence and a new singular Legion and timeline would begin... commonly referred to as "reboot Legion" or "Post Zero Hour Legion".

questions.text: In the post Zero Hour reboot continuity, Dirk Morgna once again is imbued with the powers of heat and light.  The Legion helps in assisting him get control of these powers, but he never becomes Sun Boy, or join the Legion of Super Heroes.  In this continuity a girl name Sandy Anderson fills his 'position' within the group.  What is her code name?
questions.explanation:
Inferno.

	Sandy would be the second Legion character to use this code name.  She was originally a member of Work Force, then joined the Legion of Super Heroes.  During one particular battle where several Legionnaires were sent to the past, Sandy elected to stay there when the others returned to the 30th century.

questions.text: In the Legion 'threeboot' continuity, Sun Boy is an early member of the group. However, wanting to spread his wings and be a leader, he resigns from the LSH in order to assist a group of heroes previously misguided by the villain called Lemnos.  What was the name of this team?
questions.explanation:
Terra Firma.

	Eventually this version of Sun Boy would admit defeat in being unable to rehabilitate the members of Terra Firma and he would request the Legion put him up for a vote to be readmitted to the Legion.

questions.text: Original continuity, 5 Year Later continuity, Post Zero Hour/Reboot continuity, Threeboot continuity, and Retroboot/New 52 continuity; through them all, how many times has the character of Sun Boy been killed?
questions.explanation:
Three.

	The original version of the character was first killed in the '5 Year Later' continuity by his occasional lover, Circe, in what can only be called an act of mercy (1992).  The 'threeboot' version of Sun Boy is killed by Superboy-Prime in "Legion of Three Worlds" #3 (2008).  The 'retroboot' version of Sun Boy was killed in a starcruiser crash on a foreign planet... where the sentient race subsequently cooked and ate him (2013).   Yup, you read that correctly.
